intro: Lychnophora heterotheca, commonly known as the Brazilian peppertree, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by birds and mammals. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along riverbanks. Due to its invasive nature in some regions, it is considered a problematic species in certain ecosystems.
